catalog_info.title: Happiness
catalog_info.prereq: Course open to Freshman Students Only
catalog_info.description: What is happiness?  To what extent is our own happiness under our control, and what are the causes and consequences of happiness?  Is happiness important for living a good and successful life?  How does the pursuit of personal happiness interact with our obligations to others?  In this seminar we will work toward answering these and other questions by analyzing recent work from both philosophy and psychology.  Our goal is to construct a unified picture of happiness that incorporates what is best from both disciplines but appropriately takes into account various challenges that each has posed for the other.
